description: Former Arkansas wide receiver Kendrick Edwards is transferring to Arkansas State, he announced Wednesday on Twitter.
title: Edwards transferring to Arkansas State
text:
Arkansas receiver Kendrick Edwards attempts to catch a pass during a game against Auburn on Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, at Razorback Stadium in Fayetteville. - Photo by Michael Woods
Former Arkansas wide receiver Kendrick Edwards is transferring to Arkansas State, he announced Wednesday on Twitter.
More from WholeHogSports Former Hog tops former Red Wolf in MLB
Edwards caught eight passes for 121 yards and one touchdown in two seasons with the Razorbacks.
He and fellow Miami, Florida, wide receiver product Jojo Robinson were dismissed from the team midway through last season.
Head coach Bret Bielema said in October that he expected Edwards to transfer to an ACC program, but he will end up across the state instead. Robinson has announced he is transferring to Independence Community College in Kansas.
Other players from last year's team that have transferred include running back Denzell Evans (SMU) and defensive lineman Anthony Brown (Tennessee-Martin).
